title: Sri Lanka Treasury bill yields up, 12-month at 24.36-pct
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s Treasury bill yields rose across maturities with the 3-month yield up 350 basis points to 23.21 percent, though only half the offered volumes was sold, data from the state debt office showed.
The 6-month yield went up 204 basis points to 24.77 percent.
The 12-month yield went up 100 basis points to 23.36 percent.
The debt office sold 45.15 billion rupees of 3-month bills, 1,997 million rupees of 6-month bills of 12-month bills, totaling 48.06 billion rupees.
The debt office offered 97.5 billion rupees of bills and sold only 49 percent.  (Colombo/Apr20/2022)
